The aim of this study was to compare the efficacy of augmenting trabeculectomy with subconjunctival
mitomycin
C versus
5 fluorouracil
in lowering intraocular pressure .
Forty eyes from 40 patients referred to the Nikoukari Ophthalmology University Hospital, Tabriz University of Medical Sciences, Tabriz, Iran, were enrolled in a randomized clinical trial.
Patients
with high risk open angle glaucoma were allocated to receive either subconjunctival Trabeculectomy With Subconjunctival Mitomycin C or Tmmc ) Versus 5 Fluorouracil.
Mean overall preoperative Intraocular Pressure was 30.8 mmHg. Mean preoperative Intraocular Pressures in the Trabeculectomy With Subconjunctival Mitomycin C and Tmmc ) Versus 5 Fluorouracil groups were 31.2 +/ 9.8 and 30.6 +/ 9.9 mmHg, respectively. Postoperatively, mean
Intraocular Pressures
were
11.4.3 +/ 4.9
and
13.6 +/ 3.9 mmHg
, respectively for Trabeculectomy With Subconjunctival Mitomycin C and Tmmc ) Versus 5 Fluorouracil groups after _POFT_. In spite of some existing descriptive differences in Intraocular Pressure between the groups, statistical tests showed no difference in mean and median Intraocular Pressure. Three cases of hypotonia (Intraocular Pressure _CRI_) and 1 case of epithelial keratitis were detected.
Trabeculectomy With Subconjunctival Mitomycin C and Tmmc ) Versus 5 Fluorouracil appeared to have similar efficacy in lowering Intraocular Pressure.
Augmenting trabeculectomy in glaucoma with subconjunctival mitomycin C versus subconjunctival 5-fluorouracil: a randomized clinical trial.
